### Request for Proposal Description

The First Nations and Inuit Health Branch (FNIHB) Manitoba Region seeks a biomedical waste collection and disposal service from a qualified contractor. The proposed contract period is from April 1st, 2023 to March 31st, 2024 with up to three option periods.

### Scope of Work

The contractor will be responsible for collecting and disposing of biomedical waste from nursing stations, health centers, two hospitals, and a warehouse in the Department of Indigenous Services, Manitoba Region. Regular collection and disposal services will be required in accordance with applicable regulations.

### Key Deliverables

* Biological waste collection and disposal services on an "as and when" requested basis
* Medical waste delivery and collection through both road and air transportation
* Compliance with current federal, provincial, and municipal regulations
* Provision of disposal certificates with each invoice
* Use of contractor's own equipment and software for contract performance

### Requirements

* Contractor must meet or exceed regulatory requirements
* Contractor must have experience in handling and disposing of biomedical waste
* Contractor must be able to transport and store medical waste securely
* Contractor must provide a disposal certificate with each invoice
